name: #21 Dursasana
description:
The second son of 100 Kurava, the Son of Drestarastra and Gandhari. He was the main perpetrator in Drupadi's public humiliation. An event where Bhima then swore an oath to tear open Dursasana's chest. 
Dursasana was devoted to his older brother Duryodhana. Along with Duryodhana and Sengkuni, he was closely involved in the various schemes to kill the Pandavas.

Although normally known as a coward, Dursasana was the warrior who shot the first arrow in the Great War. On one day he's able to resist all the Pandavas single-handedly. On the seventeenth day, Dursasana encountered Bhima in a duel, where Dursasana met his horrible death and Bhima fulfilled his oath.
